===== Intro paragraph ===== Grasping the basics is something I’ve been struggling with a lot. Maybe this is more prevalent in our industry, but people seem to often talk with certainty about things they don’t really understand. I was reading this book and I realized that I need to work on the basics of distributed datastores. I always want to grasp the fundamentals of the topics I am working with. I did not realize how poor was my understanding of consistency until I read its different meanings in this book by Martin Klepmann. Did it ever happen to you that you read something and you go, oh, this was so obvious, but I failed to see it before. Maybe I did not understand exactly what consistency was. Sometimes you need things concisely spelled out to make sense.

I found a very crisp and clear explanation of the term consistency in different areas of distributed datastores while reading the book by Martin Kleppman, Designing Data-Intensive Applications: The Big Ideas Behind Reliable, Scalable, and Maintainable Systems. In general, this book is full of treasures. I couldn’t recommend it more.
